page.title: 02Unemployment ,Liskeard Area
page.content: Unemployment and its related social and financial problems remains a cause for much local concern;a concern often reflected in the area's media. The number of people registered as unemployed for the first 6 months of 1985 were:-Jan.754:Feb.736:Mar.719: Apr.691:May 692:June 663. In May 1985,the Job Centre placed 61 in work to leave 692 (444 men) on its register; 31 more than May 1984. 8 of the 692 were aged under 18. In June 1985,the Centre registered 663 people (425 men);117 more than June 1984. Seasonal work tied to the holiday trade usually lessens the number of unemployed during the summer months but it is generally felt that the long -term prospects for creating full and lasting employment either locally or within commuting distance will remain poor for many years to come.
